name: Crossroads Grassroots Policy Strategies (GPS)
description: Works in conjunction with American Crossroads, a conservative Super PAC, which was formed in part by Karl Rove. Crossroads GPS has been running issue ads to support Missouri Republican candidates for U.S. Senate.

name: Americans for Prosperity
description: Americans for Prosperity was founded by David Koch, a GOP supporter, and its president is Tim Phillips, a Republican strategist. The groups's mission states it advocates for smaller government and low taxes. It has run issue ads aimed at incumbent U.S. Senator Claire McCaskill. Associated with Americans for Prosperity Foundation, a 501(c)(3) organization.

name: National Republican Senatorial Committee
description: The NRSC's focus is to support Republican candidates running for U.S. Senate.

name: Democratic Senatorial Campaign Committee
description: The DSCC's focus is to support Democratic candidates running for U.S. Senate.

name: Citizens to Elect John Wright
race: State House of Representatives for the 47th District

name: Restoring America, Inc.
description: This committee ran last minute ads supporting Todd Akin in the last days of the primary, according to its FEC filings.

name: U.S. Chamber of Commerce
description: The U.S. Chamber of Commerce endorsed John Brunner early on in the primary race and subsequently ran ads opposing Claire McCaskill. This is an independent group, not associated with or defined as a type of PAC.

name: Missourians For Health And Education
description: Associated with the American Cancer Society. This group has bought out time to run ads closer to the November general election in order to support a ballot initiative that would increase Missouri's tobacco tax.

name: Dixon for Osage County Sheriff
description: Michael Dixon Jr. does not have an official committee filed with the MEC. The candidate is paying for his campaign material himself, according to his website.
